summary: This document is an email chain from May-June 2021 between U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) contractors and FBI agents regarding the coordination of transferring a large (over 200GB) hard drive containing case materials for the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution. The emails discuss logistics for delivering and uploading the data to a secure system (USAfx).

persons.name: Mandy
persons.context: Referred to as the person who was going to coordinate returning a hard drive to the US Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Amanda Nicole Young
persons.context: FBI agent from the New York office cc'd on emails regarding the transfer of Maxwell case materials.

persons.name: Special Agent E.
persons.role: FBI Special Agent - Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.context: Primary FBI contact coordinating the upload of over 200GB of Maxwell case materials to a hard drive for the US Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Both are FBI agents from the New York office working on the Maxwell case, cc'd on the same coordination emails.
Mandy is referenced as coordinating with Special Agent E. to return a hard drive to the US Attorney's Office.
S, a US Attorney's Office contractor, is looped in to help coordinate obtaining a hard drive for Special Agent E. to upload case materials.

events.title: Initial request to coordinate Maxwell case file transfer
events.description: An email is sent requesting coordination to receive a new file for the Maxwell case from the FBI via the USAfx system.

events.title: Hard drive coordination for 200GB+ Maxwell materials
events.description: Multiple emails discuss sourcing a 250GB+ hard drive and coordinating pick-up/drop-off so the FBI can upload over 200GB of Maxwell case materials.

events.title: Follow-up on hard drive return and upload progress
events.description: Follow-up emails confirm the hard drive was given to Mandy and inquire about the progress of loading the materials.

locations: 290 (likely refers to 290 Broadway, a known FBI New York field office location)
1SA (likely refers to One St. Andrew's Plaza, the address for the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The FBI had over 200GB of case materials related to the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution that needed to be transferred to the U.S. Attorney's Office in mid-2021.
Coordination involved physically transferring a hard drive due to the large data size, highlighting the volume of evidence.
The emails show active evidence management and collaboration between the FBI's Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force and the U.S. Attorney's Office on the Maxwell case.
Multiple individuals, including FBI Special Agent E. and Amanda Nicole Young, were directly involved in handling the evidence transfer.
The communication uses the secure USAfx system for official file transfers related to the case.
